_header: Seely berne that not is gone

Bod425.First Lines:
Noght funden in me wickednesþat in mouth noht speke men
                    werkes…
Bod425.Last Lines:
…loues him in chimbes of mirie and blisAlkin gaste loue louerd
                    þat is
Bod425.Note:
Missing Psalms 1-15; between psalms cviii and cix, on ff. 66v-70v are
                    English poetical versions of the Four Sequences or Capitula from the Gospels; at
                    the end: ‘Qui scripsit carmen sit benedittus Amen’.

Bod921.First Lines:
Seli bern þat noght is ganeIn þe rede of wicked
                    mane…
Bod921.Last Lines:
…Loues him in chimbes of mirþe and blisseAlkyn gast loue
                    louerd þat isse
Bod921.Note: Psalms start with Latin first lines.

CamCCC278.First Lines:
Seli beern þat nouht is gonIn þe red of wichked
                    man…
CamCCC278.Last Lines:
…Looues him in chimbes of miryly and blisseAlle kingost looue
                    louerd þat isse

BLCottVitAXVI.First Lines: SEli bern þat noght is ganIn þe rede of wicked man…
BLCottVitAXVI.Last Lines: …Loues him in chimbes of mirthe and blisseAlkine gaste loue lauerd þat isse
BLCottVitAXVI.Note: Latin headings or glosses in right margins throughout; last parallel with final line is ‘Laudate eum,’
BLCottVitAXVI.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 2.130-273.
Stevenson,  Joseph. 
             Anglo-Saxon and Early English Psalter.
             2 vols. 
             Surtees Society
         16 (1843), 19 (1847).

BLEge614.First Lines:
Seli beerne þat noght is ganIn þe red of wicked
                    man…
BLEge614.Last Lines:
…Heryhes him in bimbes of mirthis þat isseLett iche gast
                    heryhes louard hysse
BLEge614.Note:
Large initial has been cut away. This has also removed the initial
                    letters of the words ‘Seli’ and ‘in‘, which have
                    subsequently been replaced by a later hand (f. 2).
BLEge614.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 2.130-273.

BLHar1770.First Lines: Seli berne þat noht is ganIn þe red of wiked man…
BLHar1770.Last Lines: …Loues him in chimbes of mirþe and blisseAlkin gast looue lauerd þat isse
BLHar1770.Note: Preceded by Latin line, “Beatus Ihesu qui non abiit” (f. 158).
